title: Step 8: Origin
description: Where do you come from? (Choose a Social Skill)

options.name: The Hammer
options.narrative: The Threat. Using physical presence, volume, or violence to force compliance. "Get out of my way or I'll go through you."

options.name: The Quill
options.narrative: The Jab. Fast talk, witty comebacks, and stinging insults. Using words like a rapier. "Nice outfit. Did you lose a bet?"

options.name: The Gaze
options.narrative: The Pressure. Relentless, unblinking pressure. Not shouting, just refusing to back down until they crack. "I can wait all day."

options.name: The Ledger
options.narrative: The Argument. Using facts, laws, and logical fallacies to dismantle their point. "Actually, regulation 4.B clearly states..."

options.name: The Lens
options.narrative: The Read. Cold reading. Calling out their ticks, secrets, or lies to rattle them. "You're sweating. What are you afraid of?"

options.name: The Stage
options.narrative: The Performance. Seduction, inspiration, or active deception. Making them want to agree with you. "Trust me, it's for the best."

options.name: The Ego
options.narrative: The Tank. Taking the insult on the chin and not flinching. "Is that the best you've got?"

options.name: The Mask
options.narrative: The Dodge. Changing the subject, feigning ignorance, or hiding your true emotion. "I haven't the faintest idea what you mean."

options.name: The Halo
options.narrative: The Glow. Being naturally likable. Insults slide off because you are simply too radiant/cool to care. "Oh, you're adorable."

options.name: The Title
options.narrative: The Rank. Using protocol and tradition as a shield. "One does not speak to the Crown in that tone."

options.name: The Badge
options.narrative: The Wall. Iron will. Refusing to be baited or broken by sheer mental fortitude. "Your orders are irrelevant."

options.name: The Vibe
options.narrative: The Sense. Sensing the emotional intent behind the words and defusing it before it lands. "I know you're angry, but this isn't about me."

title: Step 9: Childhood
description: What did you do as a child? (Choose a Utility Skill)

options.name: Athletics
options.narrative: Swimming climbing breaking objects. Lore: War tactics and sieges.

options.name: Labor
options.narrative: Sustained heavy work carrying loads. Lore: Structure and masonry.

options.name: Mechanism
options.narrative: Picking locks disarming traps. Lore: Gears and complex devices.

options.name: Motion
options.narrative: Acrobatics stealth balancing. Lore: Ballistics and physics of speed.

options.name: Nature
options.narrative: Survival handling animals. Lore: Biology ecology and healing.

options.name: Craft
options.narrative: Repairing gear smithing hardening. Lore: Physiology and metallurgy.

options.name: Academics
options.narrative: Researching libraries. Lore: History languages and heraldry.

options.name: Analysis
options.narrative: Solving puzzles deduction. Lore: Math engineering and chemistry.

options.name: Scouting
options.narrative: Tracking spotting danger. Lore: Forensics and investigation.

options.name: Mysticism
options.narrative: Gut-feeling pathfinding. Lore: Folklore spirits and omens.

options.name: Performance
options.narrative: Acting disguise. Lore: Art culture and high fashion.

options.name: Command
options.narrative: Leadership interrogation. Lore: Religion theology and cults.

title: Step 10: Apprenticeship
description: What trade did you learn? (Choose a Tool Skill)

options.name: Shield
options.narrative: Mastery of bucklers heaters and tower shields for active cover and bashing.

options.name: Snares
options.narrative: Mastery of caltrops tripwires and smoke bombs to control the ground.

options.name: Tinctures
options.narrative: Mastery of non-magical aids like herbal salves bandages and stimulants.

options.name: Catalysts
options.narrative: Mastery of items that channel magic such as scrolls wands and staves.

options.name: Curios
options.narrative: Mastery of gaming sets dice tarot and tokens of luck/fate.

options.name: Regalia
options.narrative: Mastery of banners warhorns and badges to signal and rally troops.

title: Step 11: Coming of Age
description: You learned to fight. (Choose a Melee Weapon Skill)

options.name: The Breakers
options.narrative: Impact. Raw muscle to swing heavy metal.

options.name: The Blades
options.narrative: Precision. Hand-eye coordination and dexterity.

options.name: The Fist
options.narrative: Clinch. Using your body’s hardness as a weapon.

options.name: The Long Blade
options.narrative: Parry. Technical fighting. Analyzing the duel.

options.name: The Polearms
options.narrative: Reach. Spatial awareness. Keeping the enemy at exact range.

options.name: Melee Exotics
options.narrative: Wrap. Performance. Flow. Distracting the enemy.

title: Step 12: Training
description: You learned to survive. (Choose an Armor Skill)

options.name: Plate
options.narrative: Bulwark. You are the anvil. You absorb the blow.

options.name: Bio
options.narrative: Reliable. "Living Armor made of once living material"

options.name: Light
options.narrative: Silent. Armor that allows you to dodge and twist.

options.name: Robes
options.narrative: Mana-Weave. Warding patterns that require academic understanding.

options.name: Mail
options.narrative: Cover. Scales or flexible metal that moves with you.

options.name: Rigs
options.narrative: Deep Pockets. Preparedness. Having the right tool in the right pocket by instinct.

title: Step 13: Catalyst
description: Something changed you. (Choose a Ranged Weapon Skill)

options.name: The Draw
options.narrative: Power Shot.  weight requires strength.

options.name: The Thrown
options.narrative: Dual-Utility. Flick of the wrist and balance.

options.name: The Simple Shot
options.narrative: Mobile Fire. Cardio. Running and gunning without shaking.

options.name: The Blast
options.narrative: Splash.  Calculating arc, fuse time, and chemical mix.

options.name: The Long Shot
options.narrative: Pierce. Aim. Lining up the sights. The Sniper.

options.name: Ranged Exotics
options.narrative: Debilitate. Tricky, annoying, and stylish tools.
